Running the Arcane talent build:
Rawr optimizes to 14% hit.  It should only optimize to 7% (for alliance, speaking of which, where is the Dreani buff to check off for 1% hit?).  I have a custom rule for 184 hit that used to work back in pre-litch king (in the past the rawr optizmizer used to spot say 2 hit points short of 7%).  Perhaps both of these issues could be fixed.

Comments.Message: Well if you didn't select buffs then obviously it will go for more hit%. Just select the hit% buffs. There is a tab that is called Buffs, you should use it.

Sorry if the description was unclear.  Improved Faire Fire is selected is selected from the tab called Buffs.  The talents Arcane Focus and Precision are 3/3.  Rawr is solving for 14% hit with arcane, it should be solving for 8%.
Can you clarify, Iissom? What do you mean by "Rawr is solving for 14% hit"?

Btw: The Precision talent is included in the 14% number youre seeing, so are any other +hit% buffs that apply to all schools like Improved Faire Fire spells (and others).  The only thing that is not included is "Arcane Focus" because it only applies to Arcane Spells.  So... if you add the 3% from Arcane Focus to 14%, you get the 17% hit cap.

You just failed to consider that the buffs and talents are included in the 14% total.

I understand that Arcane Focus only applies to arcane spells, but if you're arcane spec then that's the only type of spells you should use.  Rawr will suggest +hit gear for me even though I know I'm hit-capped as Arcane.  That gets kind of annoying.  Under Spell Info, it tells me I have a 98.83% hit rate with Arcane Blast even though with 2/3 Arcane Focus and 3/3 Precision, I'm at 13.83% hit.  I should only need 12% from gear with those talents to hit 100% of the time on Arcane Blast.  

Please explain that.
You're at 13.83% hit INCLUDING TALENTS AND BUFFS THAT AFFECT ALL SCHOOLS. This means you're at 15.83% for arcane.
